website_summaries.verdict: The LG Lucid 2 is a solid option for Verizon buyers on a budget, but it isn't quite as sweet a deal as the first time around.

customer_reviews.title: Cannot be activated on Verizon network
customer_reviews.text: Everything with the phone and delivery was fine, but I could not get activated on Verizon network, something abut it not being hd, whatever that means. Also Verizon informed me that as of the end of 2019 all 3g phones will have to be replaced as they will be deactivated on their network. Apparently some of the 4 g phones as well given this phone is supposed to be 4 g.
customer_reviews.author: JM

customer_reviews.title: Great Phone!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this phone as my first smart phone. So far the only thing hindering the performance of this phone is my dragging my feet in reading the manual. I guess that is because I have been able to figure out the operations by using the tutorial videos on the phone and by using my intuition. I would definitely recommend this phone because the size is not too small and not too large. It is extremely lightweight until you put a cover on it.

customer_reviews.title: Good screen. Right size for me (not too large) ...
customer_reviews.text: Looks new. Good screen. Right size for me (not too large) and performance, both cellular and as a small tablet, are very good. Battery life is much better than my previous phone(a Droid-X2). One reason I choose it is it accepts SD cards. This helps with music, etc. Works perfectly with Page Plus too. For the money, it would be hard to beat. I really wish it was rooted so I could delete the Verizon thrash apps but, I won't risk doing that as it would be only a convenience.
